Replying to @ChrisFerdinandi 2018-02-26 13:25
@ChrisFerdinandi Yep! Since its job is to manage assets directly to your git repo, it doesn't depend on @Netlify. It needs the Github API. You could use it with some other CI which watches your repo for changes and triggers builds. If you use Netlify Identity it needs to be on Netlify though.
